item.title: Collectibles Guide: Best Cheap Collectibles & Deals Now
item.description:
3 Collectibles You Don’t Want to Miss — small buys, big character

Collectibles can tell stories and lift a shelf. These three items on eBay UK — a branded toast rack and two gilt pheasant glasses — are cheap collectibles that punch above their price. Read on for exact prices, conditions, shipping notes, care tips, and which piece is best for display, drinking, or gift-giving.

1. Lurpak Limited Edition Douglas Toast Rack - Very Good Condition w/ Box

item.title: Collectibles Deals: Best Cheap Finds - 3 Multibuy Picks
item.description:
Deal Alert: 3 Collectibles at Great Prices

If you collect vintage glassware, branded kitchenware, or animal-themed barware, these three eBay finds are worth a look — each is priced between £10 and £13 and represents strong value compared with similar listings in the UK collectibles market. Read on for exact prices, condition, shipping notes, clear buying advice, and why each piece could be the best addition to your collection.

Quick snapshot — what you’ll find

  • A branded Lurpak limited‑edition toast rack in very good condition for £9.72.
  • A rare 1970s gilt flying pheasant beer/lager glass for £12.99 (New (other), single piece, multibuy available).
  • A vintage gilt pheasant whiskey glass for £12.99 (New (other), single piece, multibuy available).

1) Best value-for-money: Lurpak Limited Edition Douglas Toast Rack — £9.72 (Pre-owned)

item.title: Buy Collectibles Online: Best Affordable Collectibles
item.description:
The Ultimate Guide to Buying Collectibles Online

Collecting is part treasure hunt, part personal history. Whether you’re drawn to model planes, boxed book sets, or military aviation replicas, buying collectibles online opens up options you won’t find locally. The three listings below fall in the £27–£41 range — affordable enough to start or expand a collection without breaking the bank. I’ll walk you through what makes each item worth buying, what to watch for when shopping, and how to score the best finds.
